title: Federal, provincial govts to cooperate with KMC for issues resolution: PM
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 25 (APP): Caretaker Prime Minister Anwaar-ul-Haq Kakar on Friday said that the federal and provincial governments would extend their cooperation to Karachi Metropolitan Corporation to help resolve the issues confronting Karachi city.
The prime minister, in a meeting with Karachi Mayor Murtaza Wahab here, said that being an industrial and commercial hub, Karachi had a significant role in Pakistan’s economic development.
In the meeting, Karachi Mayor briefed the prime minister about the administrative affairs of Karachi.
The prime minister said during his maiden visit to Karachi as caretaker prime minister he, as his foremost priority, had issued instruction to resolve traders’ issues during an interaction with them.
